member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipFile
member.summary:
This class represents a Zip archive. You can ask for the contained entries, or get an input stream for a file entry. The entry is automatically decompressed.
You can also update the archive adding or deleting entries.
This class is thread safe for input: You can open input streams for arbitrary entries in different threads.
Author of the original java version : Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.InflaterInputStream
member.summary:
This filter stream is used to decompress data compressed using the "deflate" format. The "deflate" format is described in RFC 1951.
This stream may form the basis for other decompression filters, such as the GZipInputStream.
Author of the original java version : John Leuner.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.FindLongestMatch(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Find the best (longest) string in the window matching the string starting at strstart.
Preconditions:
strstart + MAX_MATCH <= window.length.
member.returns: True if a match greater than the minimum length is found

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.head
member.summary: Hashtable, hashing three characters to an index for window, so that window[index]..window[index+2] have this hash code. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xffff.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.prev
member.summary: prev[index & WMASK] points to the previous index that has the same hash code as the string starting at index. This way entries with the same hash code are in a linked list. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xffff.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.strstart
member.summary: Points to the current character in the window.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.lookahead
member.summary: lookahead is the number of characters starting at strstart in window that are valid. So window[strstart] until window[strstart+lookahead-1] are valid characters.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.window
member.summary: This array contains the part of the uncompressed stream that is of relevance. The current character is indexed by strstart.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a type is defined for protocol-buffer serialization.

member.summary: Gets or sets the defined name of the type.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.ImplicitFirstTag
member.summary: Gets or sets the fist offset to use with implicit field tags; only uesd if ImplicitFields is set.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.UseProtoMembersOnly
member.summary: If specified, alternative contract markers (such as markers for XmlSerailizer or DataContractSerializer) are ignored.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.ImplicitFields
member.summary: Gets or sets the mechanism used to automatically infer field tags for members. This option should be used in advanced scenarios only. Please review the important notes against the ImplicitFields enumeration.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.InferTagFromName
member.summary: Enables/disables automatic tag generation based on the existing name / order of the defined members. This option is not used for members marked with ProtoMemberAttribute, as intended to provide compatibility with WCF serialization. WARNING: when adding new fields you must take care to increase the Order for new elements, otherwise data corruption may occur.
member.remarks: If not specified, the default is assumed from .

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.InferTagFromNameHasValue
member.summary: Has a InferTagFromName value been explicitly set? if not, the default from the type-model is assumed.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.DataMemberOffset
member.summary:
Specifies an offset to apply to [DataMember(Order=...)] markers; this is useful when working with mex-generated classes that have a different origin (usually 1 vs 0) than the original data-contract.
This value is added to the Order of each member.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.IsStrict
member.summary: Indicates whether this field should follow strict encoding rules; this means (for example) that if a "fixed32" is encountered when "variant" is defined, then it will fail (throw an exception) when parsing. Note that when serializing the defined type is always used.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.IsPacked

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.IsRequired

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.Name

member.summary: This is the more "complete" version of Serialize, which handles single instances of mapped types. The value is written as a complete field, including field-header and (for sub-objects) a length-prefix In addition to that, this provides support for: - basic values; individual int / string / Guid / etc - IEnumerable sequences of any type handled by TrySerializeAuxiliaryType

member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance (or null), using length-prefixed data - useful with network IO.
member.param: The existing instance to be modified (can be null).
The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.
The tag used as a prefix to each record (only used with base-128 style prefixes).

How to encode the length prefix.
The tag used as a prefix to each record (only used with base-128 style prefixes).
Used to resolve types on a per-field basis.
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.

member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance (or null), using length-prefixed data - useful with network IO.

The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.
The tag used as a prefix to each record (only used with base-128 style prefixes).
Used to resolve types on a per-field basis.
Returns the number of bytes consumed by this operation (includes length-prefix overheads and any skipped data).
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.DeserializeItems(System.IO.Stream,System.Type,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.Serializer.TypeResolver)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of consecutive length-prefixed items from a stream, using either base-128 or fixed-length prefixes. Base-128 prefixes with a tag are directly comparable to serializing multiple items in succession (use the tag to emulate the implicit behavior when serializing a list/array). When a tag is specified, any records with different tags are silently omitted. The tag is ignored. The tag is ignores for fixed-length prefixes.
member.param: The binary stream containing the serialized records.
The prefix style used in the data.
The tag of records to return (if non-positive, then no tag is expected and all records are returned).
On a field-by-field basis, the type of object to deserialize (can be null if "type" is specified).
The type of object to deserialize (can be null if "resolver" is specified).
member.returns: The sequence of deserialized objects.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.DeserializeItems``1(System.IO.Stream,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of consecutive length-prefixed items from a stream, using either base-128 or fixed-length prefixes. Base-128 prefixes with a tag are directly comparable to serializing multiple items in succession (use the tag to emulate the implicit behavior when serializing a list/array). When a tag is specified, any records with different tags are silently omitted. The tag is ignored. The tag is ignores for fixed-length prefixes.
member.typeparam: The type of object to deserialize.
member.param: The binary stream containing the serialized records.
The prefix style used in the data.
The tag of records to return (if non-positive, then no tag is expected and all records are returned).
member.returns: The sequence of deserialized objects.

member.summary: Writes a protocol-buffer representation of the given instance to the supplied stream, with a length-prefix. This is useful for socket programming, as DeserializeWithLengthPrefix can be used to read the single object back from an ongoing stream.
member.param: The existing instance to be serialized (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.
The destination stream to write to.
The tag used as a prefix to each record (only used with base-128 style prefixes).

member.summary: Adds support for an additional type in this model, optionally appplying inbuilt patterns. If the type is already known to the model, the existing type is returned **without** applying any additional behaviour.
member.remarks: Inbuilt patterns include: [ProtoContract]/[ProtoMember(n)] [DataContract]/[DataMember(Order=n)] [XmlType]/[XmlElement(Order=n)] [On{Des|S}erializ{ing|ed}] ShouldSerialize*/*Specified
member.param: Whether to apply the inbuilt configuration patterns (via attributes etc), or just add the type with no additional configuration (the type must then be manually configured).
member.returns: The MetaType representing this type, allowing further configuration.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.IExtension
member.summary: Provides addition capability for supporting unexpected fields during protocol-buffer serialization/deserialization. This allows for loss-less round-trip/merge, even when the data is not fully understood.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.IExtension.BeginAppend
member.summary: Requests a stream into which any unexpected fields can be persisted.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.IExtension.EndAppend(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Indicates that all unexpected fields have now been stored. The implementing class is responsible for closing the stream. If "commit" is not true the data may be discarded.
member.param: The stream originally obtained by BeginAppend.
True if the append operation completed successfully.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.IExtension.BeginQuery
member.summary: Requests a stream of the unexpected fields previously stored.
member.returns: A prepared stream of the unexpected fields.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.IExtension.EndQuery(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Indicates that all unexpected fields have now been read. The implementing class is responsible for closing the stream.
member.param: The stream originally obtained by BeginQuery.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.IExtension.GetLength
member.summary: Requests the length of the raw binary stream; this is used when serializing sub-entities to indicate the expected size.
member.returns: The length of the binary stream representing unexpected data.

www.Redivivus.in (suraj.supekar@redivivus.in) - Ported from ZXING Java Source

member.summary: Sets a block of 32 bits, starting at bit i.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.EndSubItem(ProtoBuf.SubItemToken,ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Makes the end of consuming a nested message in the stream; the stream must be either at the correct EndGroup marker, or all fields of the sub-message must have been consumed (in either case, this means ReadFieldHeader should return zero)

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.StartSubItem(ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Begins consuming a nested message in the stream; supported wire-types: StartGroup, String
member.remarks: The token returned must be help and used when callining EndSubItem

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadFieldHeader
member.summary: Reads a field header from the stream, setting the wire-type and retuning the field number. If no more fields are available, then 0 is returned. This methods respects sub-messages.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.TryReadFieldHeader(System.Int32)
member.summary: Looks ahead to see whether the next field in the stream is what we expect (typically; what we've just finished reading - for example ot read successive list items)

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.Hint(ProtoBuf.WireType)
member.summary: Compares the streams current wire-type to the hinted wire-type, updating the reader if necessary; for example, a Variant may be updated to SignedVariant. If the hinted wire-type is unrelated then no change is made.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.Assert(ProtoBuf.WireType)
member.summary: Verifies that the stream's current wire-type is as expected, or a specialized sub-type (for example, SignedVariant) - in which case the current wire-type is updated. Otherwise an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.SkipField

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Serializer
member.summary: Provides protocol-buffer serialization capability for concrete, attributed types. This is a *default* model, but custom serializer models are also supported.
member.remarks: Protocol-buffer serialization is a compact binary format, designed to take advantage of sparse data and knowledge of specific data types; it is also extensible, allowing a type to be deserialized / merged even if some data is not recognised.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.Serializer.ListItemTag
member.summary: The field number that is used as a default when serializing/deserializing a list of objects. The data is treated as repeated message with field number 1.

member.returns: The .proto definition as a string

member.summary: Create a deep clone of the supplied instance; any sub-items are also cloned.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.Merge``1(System.IO.Stream,``0)
member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance.
member.param: The existing instance to be modified (can be null).
The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.Deserialize``1(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a new instance from a protocol-buffer stream

member.returns: A new, initialized instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.ChangeType``2(``0)
member.summary: Serializes a given instance and deserializes it as a different type; this can be used to translate between wire-compatible objects (where two .NET types represent the same data), or to promote/demote a type through an inheritance hierarchy.
member.remarks: No assumption of compatibility is made between the types.
member.typeparam: The type of the object being copied.
The type of the new object to be created.
member.param: The existing instance to use as a template.
member.returns: A new instane of type TNewType, with the data from TOldType.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.PrepareSerializer``1
member.summary: Precompiles the serializer for a given type.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.DeserializeItems``1(System.IO.Stream,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of consecutive length-prefixed items from a stream, using either base-128 or fixed-length prefixes. Base-128 prefixes with a tag are directly comparable to serializing multiple items in succession (use the tag to emulate the implicit behavior when serializing a list/array). When a tag is specified, any records with different tags are silently omitted. The tag is ignored. The tag is ignores for fixed-length prefixes.
member.typeparam: The type of object to deserialize.
member.param: The binary stream containing the serialized records.
The prefix style used in the data.
The tag of records to return (if non-positive, then no tag is expected and all records are returned).
member.returns: The sequence of deserialized objects.

member.summary: Creates a new instance from a protocol-buffer stream that has a length-prefix on data (to assist with network IO).
member.param: The binary stream to apply to the new instance (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.
member.returns: A new, initialized instance.

member.summary: Creates a new instance from a protocol-buffer stream that has a length-prefix on data (to assist with network IO).

member.returns: A new, initialized instance.

member.name: T:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.qrcode.encoder.EncoderInternal
member.author: satorux@google.com (Satoru Takabayashi) - creator
dswitkin@google.com (Daniel Switkin) - ported from C++
www.Redivivus.in (suraj.supekar@redivivus.in) - Ported from ZXING Java Source

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.qrcode.encoder.EncoderInternal.encode(System.String,Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.qrcode.decoder.ErrorCorrectionLevelInternal,Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.qrcode.encoder.QRCodeInternal)
member.summary:
Encode "bytes" with the error correction level "m_EcLevelInternal". The encoding mode will be chosen internally by chooseMode(). On success, store the result in "QRCodeInternal".
We recommend you to use QRCodeInternal.EC_LEVEL_L (the lowest level) for "getECLevel" since our primary use is to show QR code on desktop screens. We don't need very strong error correction for this purpose.
Note that there is no way to encode bytes in MODE_KANJI. We might want to add EncodeWithMode() with which clients can specify the encoding mode. For now, we don't need the functionality.

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.qrcode.encoder.EncoderInternal.getAlphanumericCode(System.Int32)
member.returns: the code point of the table used in alphanumeric mode or -1 if there is no corresponding code in the table.

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.qrcode.encoder.EncoderInternal.chooseMode(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Choose the best mode by examining the content. Note that 'encoding' is used as a hint; if it is Shift_JIS, and the input is only double-byte Kanji, then we return {@link Mode#KANJI}.

member.summary: Initialize "QRCodeInternal" according to "numInputBytes", "m_EcLevelInternal", and "mode". On success, modify "QRCodeInternal".

member.summary: Terminate bits as described in 8.4.8 and 8.4.9 of JISX0510:2004 (p.24).

member.summary: Get number of data bytes and number of error correction bytes for block id "blockID". Store the result in "numDataBytesInBlock", and "numECBytesInBlock". See table 12 in 8.5.1 of JISX0510:2004 (p.30)

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.qrcode.encoder.EncoderInternal.interleaveWithECBytes(Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.qrcode.encoder.BitVector,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.qrcode.encoder.BitVector)
member.summary: Interleave "bits" with corresponding error correction bytes. On success, store the result in "result". The interleave rule is complicated. See 8.6 of JISX0510:2004 (p.37) for details.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarEntry
member.summary:
This class represents an entry in a Tar archive. It consists of the entry's header, as well as the entry's File. Entries can be instantiated in one of three ways, depending on how they are to be used.
TarEntries that are created from the header bytes read from an archive are instantiated with the TarEntry( byte[] ) constructor. These entries will be used when extracting from or listing the contents of an archive. These entries have their header filled in using the header bytes. They also set the File to null, since they reference an archive entry not a file.
TarEntries that are created from files that are to be written into an archive are instantiated with the CreateEntryFromFile(string) pseudo constructor. These entries have their header filled in using the File's information. They also keep a reference to the File for convenience when writing entries.
Finally, TarEntries can be constructed from nothing but a name. This allows the programmer to construct the entry by hand, for instance when only an InputStream is available for writing to the archive, and the header information is constructed from other information. In this case the header fields are set to defaults and the File is set to null.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Checksums.Adler32
member.summary:
Computes Adler32 checksum for a stream of data. An Adler32 checksum is not as reliable as a CRC32 checksum, but a lot faster to compute.
The specification for Adler32 may be found in RFC 1950. ZLIB Compressed Data Format Specification version 3.3)
From that document:
"ADLER32 (Adler-32 checksum) This contains a checksum value of the uncompressed data (excluding any dictionary data) computed according to Adler-32 algorithm. This algorithm is a 32-bit extension and improvement of the Fletcher algorithm, used in the ITU-T X.224 / ISO 8073 standard.
Adler-32 is composed of two sums accumulated per byte: s1 is the sum of all bytes, s2 is the sum of all s1 values. Both sums are done modulo 65521. s1 is initialized to 1, s2 to zero. The Adler-32 checksum is stored as s2*65536 + s1 in most- significant-byte first (network) order."
"8.2. The Adler-32 algorithm
The Adler-32 algorithm is much faster than the CRC32 algorithm yet still provides an extremely low probability of undetected errors.
The modulo on unsigned long accumulators can be delayed for 5552 bytes, so the modulo operation time is negligible. If the bytes are a, b, c, the second sum is 3a + 2b + c + 3, and so is position and order sensitive, unlike the first sum, which is just a checksum. That 65521 is prime is important to avoid a possible large class of two-byte errors that leave the check unchanged. (The Fletcher checksum uses 255, which is not prime and which also makes the Fletcher check insensitive to single byte changes 0 - 255.)
The sum s1 is initialized to 1 instead of zero to make the length of the sequence part of s2, so that the length does not have to be checked separately. (Any sequence of zeroes has a Fletcher checksum of zero.)"

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Checksums.IChecksum
member.summary: Interface to compute a data checksum used by checked input/output streams. A data checksum can be updated by one byte or with a byte array. After each update the value of the current checksum can be returned by calling getValue. The complete checksum object can also be reset so it can be used again with new data.

member.name: T:Mtime.Community.Utility.Json.FastJSON.JsonParser
member.summary:
This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/
JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the datatypes ArrayList and Hashtable. All numbers are parsed to doubles.

members.member: Sets the GIF frame disposal code for the last added frame and any subsequent frames. Default is 0 if no transparent color has been set, otherwise 2. @param code int disposal code.

Sets the transparent color for the last added frame and any subsequent frames. Since all colors are subject to modification in the quantization process, the color in the final palette for each frame closest to the given color becomes the transparent color for that frame. May be set to null to indicate no transparent color.
@param c Color to be treated as transparent on display.

Sets quality of color quantization (conversion of images to the maximum 256 colors allowed by the GIF specification). Lower values (minimum = 1) produce better colors, but slow processing significantly. 10 is the default, and produces good color mapping at reasonable speeds. Values greater than 20 do not yield significant improvements in speed.
@param quality int greater than 0. @return
Writes Logical Screen Descriptor
Writes color table
Writes Netscape application extension to define repeat count.
Writes Image Descriptor

member.name: T:GifUtility.PlainTextEx
member.summary: 形文本扩展(Plain Text Extension)这一部分是可选的（需要89a版本）， 用来绘制一个简单的文本图象，这一部分由用来绘制的纯文本数据（7-bit ASCII字符） 和控制绘制的参数等组成。绘制文本借助于一个文本框（Text Grid）来定义边界，在文 本框中划分多个单元格，每个字符占用一个单元，绘制时按从左到右、从上到下的顺序 依次进行，直到最后一个字符或者占满整个文本框（之后的字符将被忽略，因此定义文 本框的大小时应该注意到是否可以容纳整个文本），绘制文本的颜色使用全局颜色列表， 没有则可以使用一个已经保存的前一个颜色列表。另外，图形文本扩展块也属于图形块 (Graphic Rendering Block)，可以在它前面定义图形控制扩展对它的表现形式进一步修改。

member.name: F:GifUtility.PlainTextEx.BlockSize
member.summary: Block Size - 块大小，固定值12

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipOutputStream
member.summary:
This is a DeflaterOutputStream that writes the files into a zip archive one after another. It has a special method to start a new zip entry. The zip entries contains information about the file name size, compressed size, CRC, etc.
It includes support for Stored and Deflated entries. This class is not thread safe.
Author of the original java version : Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarArchive
member.summary:
The TarArchive class implements the concept of a 'Tape Archive'. A tar archive is a series of entries, each of which represents a file system object. Each entry in the archive consists of a header block followed by 0 or more data blocks. Directory entries consist only of the header block, and are followed by entries for the directory's contents. File entries consist of a header followed by the number of blocks needed to contain the file's contents. All entries are written on block boundaries. Blocks are 512 bytes long.
TarArchives are instantiated in either read or write mode, based upon whether they are instantiated with an InputStream or an OutputStream. Once instantiated TarArchives read/write mode can not be changed.
There is currently no support for random access to tar archives. However, it seems that subclassing TarArchive, and using the TarBuffer.CurrentRecord and TarBuffer.CurrentBlock properties, this would be rather trivial.

member.summary: Write an entry to the archive. This method will call the putNextEntry and then write the contents of the entry, and finally call closeEntry() for entries that are files. For directories, it will call putNextEntry(), and then, if the recurse flag is true, process each entry that is a child of the directory.

If true, process the children of directory entries.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarArchive.AsciiTranslate
member.summary: Get/set the ascii file translation flag. If ascii file translation is true, then the file is checked to see if it a binary file or not. If the flag is true and the test indicates it is ascii text file, it will be translated. The translation converts the local operating system's concept of line ends into the UNIX line end, '\n', which is the defacto standard for a TAR archive. This makes text files compatible with UNIX.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipNameTransform.IsValidName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Test a name to see if it is a valid name for a zip entry.
member.param: If true checking is relaxed about windows file names and absolute paths.
member.returns: Returns true if the name is a valid zip name; false otherwise.
member.remarks: Zip path names are actually in Unix format, and should only contain relative paths. This means that any path stored should not contain a drive or device letter, or a leading slash. All slashes should forward slashes '/'. An empty name is valid for a file where the input comes from standard input. A null name is not considered valid.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipNameTransform.IsValidName(System.String)
member.summary: Test a name to see if it is a valid name for a zip entry.
member.returns: Returns true if the name is a valid zip name; false otherwise.
member.remarks: Zip path names are actually in unix format, and should only contain relative paths if a path is present. This means that the path stored should not contain a drive or device letter, or a leading slash. All slashes should forward slashes '/'. An empty name is valid where the input comes from standard input. A null name is not considered valid.

member.summary: Get/set the path prefix to be trimmed from paths if present.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipExtraData
member.summary: A class to handle the extra data field for Zip entries
member.remarks: Extra data contains 0 or more values each prefixed by a header tag and length. They contain zero or more bytes of actual data. The data is held internally using a copy on write strategy. This is more efficient but means that for extra data created by passing in data can have the values modified by the caller in some circumstances.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Extensible
member.summary: Simple base class for supporting unexpected fields allowing for loss-less round-tips/merge, even if the data is not understod. The additional fields are (by default) stored in-memory in a buffer.
member.remarks: As an example of an alternative implementation, you might choose to use the file system (temporary files) as the back-end, tracking only the paths [such an object would ideally be IDisposable and use a finalizer to ensure that the files are removed].

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.IExtensible
member.summary: Indicates that the implementing type has support for protocol-buffer extensions.
member.remarks: Can be implemented by deriving from .

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.IExtensible.GetExtensionObject(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the extension object for the current instance, optionally creating it if it does not already exist.
member.param: Should a new extension object be created if it does not already exist?
member.returns: The extension object if it exists (or was created), or null if the extension object does not exist or is not available.
member.remarks: The createIfMissing argument is false during serialization, and true during deserialization upon encountering unexpected fields.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Extensible.GetExtensionObject(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the extension object for the current instance, optionally creating it if it does not already exist.

member.returns: The extension object if it exists (or was created), or null if the extension object does not exist or is not available.
member.remarks: The createIfMissing argument is false during serialization, and true during deserialization upon encountering unexpected fields.

member.summary: Provides a simple, default implementation for extension support, optionally creating it if it does not already exist. Designed to be called by classes implementing .
member.param: Should a new extension object be created if it does not already exist?
The extension field to check (and possibly update).
member.returns: The extension object if it exists (or was created), or null if the extension object does not exist or is not available.
member.remarks: The createIfMissing argument is false during serialization, and true during deserialization upon encountering unexpected fields.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Extensible.AppendValue``1(ProtoBuf.IExtensible,System.Int32,``0)
member.summary: Appends the value as an additional (unexpected) data-field for the instance. Note that for non-repeated sub-objects, this equates to a merge operation; for repeated sub-objects this adds a new instance to the set; for simple values the new value supercedes the old value.
member.remarks: Note that appending a value does not remove the old value from the stream; avoid repeatedly appending values for the same field.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to append.
member.param: The extensible object to append the value to.
The field identifier; the tag should not be defined as a known data-field for the instance.

member.remarks: Note that appending a value does not remove the old value from the stream; avoid repeatedly appending values for the same field.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Extensible.GetValue``1(ProtoBuf.IExtensible,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.DataFormat)
member.summary: Queries an extensible object for an additional (unexpected) data-field for the instance. The value returned is the composed value after merging any duplicated content; if the value is "repeated" (a list), then use GetValues instead.
member.param: The extensible object to obtain the value from.
The field identifier; the tag should not be defined as a known data-field for the instance.
The data-format to use when decoding the value.
member.returns: The effective value of the field, or the default value if not found.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Extensible.TryGetValue``1(ProtoBuf.IExtensible,System.Int32,``0@)
member.param: The effective value of the field, or the default value if not found.
The extensible object to obtain the value from.
The field identifier; the tag should not be defined as a known data-field for the instance.
member.returns: True if data for the field was present, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Extensible.TryGetValue``1(ProtoBuf.IExtensible,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.DataFormat,``0@)
member.param: The effective value of the field, or the default value if not found.
The extensible object to obtain the value from.
The field identifier; the tag should not be defined as a known data-field for the instance.
The data-format to use when decoding the value.
member.returns: True if data for the field was present, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Extensible.TryGetValue``1(ProtoBuf.IExtensible,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.DataFormat,System.Boolean,``0@)
member.param: The effective value of the field, or the default value if not found.
The extensible object to obtain the value from.
The field identifier; the tag should not be defined as a known data-field for the instance.
The data-format to use when decoding the value.
Allow tags that are present as part of the definition; for example, to query unknown enum values.
member.returns: True if data for the field was present, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Extensible.GetValues``1(ProtoBuf.IExtensible,System.Int32)
member.summary: Queries an extensible object for an additional (unexpected) data-field for the instance. Each occurrence of the field is yielded separately, making this usage suitable for "repeated" (list) fields.
member.remarks: The extended data is processed lazily as the enumerator is iterated.
member.param: The extensible object to obtain the value from.
The field identifier; the tag should not be defined as a known data-field for the instance.
member.returns: An enumerator that yields each occurrence of the field.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Extensible.GetValues``1(ProtoBuf.IExtensible,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.DataFormat)
member.summary: Queries an extensible object for an additional (unexpected) data-field for the instance. Each occurrence of the field is yielded separately, making this usage suitable for "repeated" (list) fields.
member.remarks: The extended data is processed lazily as the enumerator is iterated.
member.param: The extensible object to obtain the value from.
The field identifier; the tag should not be defined as a known data-field for the instance.
The data-format to use when decoding the value.
member.returns: An enumerator that yields each occurrence of the field.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Compiler.CompilerContext.LoadNullRef
member.summary: Pushes a null reference onto the stack. Note that this should only be used to return a null (or set a variable to null); for null-tests use BranchIfTrue / BranchIfFalse.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Compiler.CompilerContext.UsingBlock.#ctor(ProtoBuf.Compiler.CompilerContext,ProtoBuf.Compiler.Local)
member.summary:
Creates a new "using" block (equivalent) around a variable; the variable must exist, and note that (unlike in C#) it is the variables *final* value that gets disposed. If you need *original* disposal, copy your variable first.
It is the callers responsibility to ensure that the variable's scope fully-encapsulates the "using"; if not, the variable may be re-used (and thus re-assigned) unexpectedly.

member.summary: Generate the signature base that is used to produce the signature

The token, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string
The token secret, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string

The signature type. To use the default values use OAuthBase.SignatureTypes.
member.returns: The signature base

member.returns: A base64 string of the hash value

半角字符转全角字符

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeFormatEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments needed to perform type-formatting functions; this could be resolving a Type to a string suitable for serialization, or could be requesting a Type from a string. If no changes are made, a default implementation will be used (from the assembly-qualified names).

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeFormatEventArgs.Type
member.summary: The type involved in this map; if this is initially null, a Type is expected to be provided for the string in FormattedName.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeFormatEventArgs.FormattedName
member.summary: The formatted-name involved in this map; if this is initially null, a formatted-name is expected from the type in Type.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeFormatEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate type used to perform type-formatting functions; the sender originates as the type-model.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ImplicitFields
member.summary: Specifies the method used to infer field tags for members of the type under consideration. Tags are deduced using the invariant alphabetic sequence of the members' names; this makes implicit field tags very brittle, and susceptible to changes such as field names (normally an isolated change).

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.ImplicitFields.None
member.summary: No members are serialized implicitly; all members require a suitable attribute such as [ProtoMember]. This is the recmomended mode for most scenarios.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.ImplicitFields.AllPublic
member.summary: Public properties and fields are eligible for implicit serialization; this treats the public API as a contract. Ordering beings from ImplicitFirstTag.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.ImplicitFields.AllFields
member.summary: Public and non-public fields are eligible for implicit serialization; this acts as a state/implementation serializer. Ordering beings from ImplicitFirstTag.

member.name: T:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256

summary.p: This class contains utility methods for performing mathematical operations over the Galois Field GF(256). Operations use a given primitive polynomial in calculations.
Throughout this package, elements of GF(256) are represented as an int for convenience and speed (but at the cost of memory). Only the bottom 8 bits are really used.

member.author: Sean Owen
www.Redivivus.in (suraj.supekar@redivivus.in) - Ported from ZXING Java Source

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a representation of GF(256) using the given primitive polynomial.
member.param: irreducible polynomial whose coefficients are represented by the bits of an int, where the least-significant bit represents the constant coefficient

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256.buildMonomial(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.returns: the monomial representing coefficient * x^degree

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256.addOrSubtract(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Implements both addition and subtraction -- they are the same in GF(256).
member.returns: sum/difference of a and b

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256.exp(System.Int32)
member.returns: 2 to the power of a in GF(256)

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256.log(System.Int32)
member.returns: base 2 log of a in GF(256)

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256.inverse(System.Int32)
member.returns: multiplicative inverse of a

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256.multiply(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.returns: product of a and b in GF(256)

member.name: T:Mtime.Community.Utility.Net.Server.BufferManager
member.summary:
This class creates a single large buffer which can be divided up and assigned to SocketAsyncEventArgs objects for use with each socket I/O operation. This enables bufffers to be easily reused and gaurds against fragmenting heap memory.
The operations exposed on the BufferManager class are not thread safe.

member.summary: Allocates buffer space used by the buffer pool

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.Net.Server.BufferManager.Set(System.Net.Sockets.SocketAsyncEventArgs)
member.summary: Assigns a buffer from the buffer pool to the specified SocketAsyncEventArgs object
member.returns: true if the buffer was successfully set, else false

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.Net.Server.BufferManager.Free(System.Net.Sockets.SocketAsyncEventArgs,System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the buffer from a SocketAsyncEventArg object. This frees the buffer back to the buffer pool

member.summary: Implements the connection logic for the socket client.

member.name: T:GifUtility.ImageDescriptor
member.summary: 图象标识符(Image Descriptor)一个GIF文件内可以包含多幅图象， 一幅图象结束之后紧接着下是一幅图象的标识符，图象标识符以0x2C(',') 字符开始，定义紧接着它的图象的性质，包括图象相对于逻辑屏幕边界的偏移量、 图象大小以及有无局部颜色列表和颜色列表大小，由10个字节组成

member.summary: packed

member.name: F:GifUtility.ImageDescriptor.LctFlag
member.summary: 局部颜色列表标志(Local Color Table Flag) 置位时标识紧接在图象标识符之后有一个局部颜色列表，供紧跟在它之后的一幅图象使用； 值否时使用全局颜色列表，忽略pixel值。

member.summary: pixel - 局部颜色列表大小(Size of Local Color Table)，pixel+1就为颜色列表的位数

member.name: P:GifUtility.GifFrame.LocalColorTable
member.summary: 局部颜色列表(Local Color Table) 如果上面的局部颜色列表标志置位的话，则需要在这里（紧跟在图象标识符之后） 定义一个局部颜色列表以供紧接着它的图象使用，注意使用前应线保存原来的颜色列表， 使用结束之后回复原来保存的全局颜色列表。如果一个GIF文件即没有提供全局颜色列表 也没有提供局部颜色列表，可以自己创建一个颜色列表，或使用系统的颜色列表。 RGBRGB......

member.name: T:Rss.RssBlogChannel
member.summary: A RSS module that adds elements at the channel level that are common to weblogs.

member.name: M:Rss.RssBlogChannel.#ctor(System.Uri,System.Uri,System.Uri,System.Uri)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the
member.param: The URL of an OPML file containing the blogroll for the site.
The URL of an OPML file containing the author's RSS subscriptions.
The URL of a weblog that the author of the weblog is promoting per Mark Pilgrim's description. "http://diveintomark.org/archives/2002/09/17.html#blink_and_youll_miss_it"

The URL of a changes.xml file. When the feed that contains this element updates, it pings a server that updates this file. The presence of this element says to aggregators that they only have to read the changes file to see if this feed has updated. If several feeds point to the same changes file, the aggregator has to do less polling, resulting in better use of server bandwidth, and the Internet as a whole; and resulting in faster scans. Everyone wins. For more technical information, see the howto on the XML-RPC site. "http://www.xmlrpc.com/weblogsComForRss"

member.summary: Bit 0 if set indicates that the file is encrypted

member.summary: Bit 3 if set indicates a trailing data desciptor is appended to the entry data

member.summary: Bit 5 if set indicates the file contains Pkzip compressed patched data. Requires version 2.7 or greater.

member.summary: Bit 6 if set strong encryption has been used for this entry.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Unused7
member.summary: Bit 7 is currently unused

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Unused8
member.summary: Bit 8 is currently unused

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Unused9
member.summary: Bit 9 is currently unused

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Unused10
member.summary: Bit 10 is currently unused

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.UnicodeText

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.EnhancedCompress
member.summary: Bit 12 is documented as being reserved by PKware for enhanced compression.

member.summary: Bit 13 if set indicates that values in the local header are masked to hide their actual values, and the central directory is encrypted.

member.summary: Bit 14 is documented as being reserved for use by PKware

member.summary: Bit 15 is documented as being reserved for use by PKware

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.DataDescriptorSignature
member.summary: Signature for data descriptor
member.remarks: This is only used where the length, Crc, or compressed size isnt known when the entry is created and the output stream doesnt support seeking. The local entry cannot be 'patched' with the correct values in this case so the values are recorded after the data prefixed by this header, as well as in the central directory.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator
member.summary:
This class allows us to retrieve a specified number of bits from the input buffer, as well as copy big byte blocks.
It uses an int buffer to store up to 31 bits for direct manipulation. This guarantees that we can get at least 16 bits, but we only need at most 15, so this is all safe.
There are some optimizations in this class, for example, you must never peek more than 8 bits more than needed, and you must first peek bits before you may drop them. This is not a general purpose class but optimized for the behaviour of the Inflater.
authors of the original java version : John Leuner, Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a default StreamManipulator with all buffers empty

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.PeekBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the next sequence of bits but don't increase input pointer. bitCount must be less or equal 16 and if this call succeeds, you must drop at least n - 8 bits in the next call.
member.param: The number of bits to peek.
member.returns: the value of the bits, or -1 if not enough bits available. */

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.DropBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Drops the next n bits from the input. You should have called PeekBits with a bigger or equal n before, to make sure that enough bits are in the bit buffer.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.GetBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the next n bits and increases input pointer. This is equivalent to followed by , except for correct error handling.
member.param: The number of bits to retrieve.
member.returns: the value of the bits, or -1 if not enough bits available.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.SkipToByteBoundary
member.summary: Skips to the next byte boundary.

member.summary: Copies bytes from input buffer to output buffer starting at output[offset]. You have to make sure, that the buffer is byte aligned. If not enough bytes are available, copies fewer bytes.
member.param: The buffer to copy bytes to.
The offset in the buffer at which copying starts
The length to copy, 0 is allowed.
member.returns: The number of bytes copied, 0 if no bytes were available.
member.exception: Length is less than zero
Bit buffer isnt byte aligned

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Core.NameFilter
member.summary: NameFilter is a string matching class which allows for both positive and negative matching. A filter is a sequence of independant regular expressions separated by semi-colons ';' Each expression can be prefixed by a plus '+' sign or a minus '-' sign to denote the expression is intended to include or exclude names. If neither a plus or minus sign is found include is the default A given name is tested for inclusion before checking exclusions. Only names matching an include spec and not matching an exclude spec are deemed to match the filter. An empty filter matches any name.
member.example: The following expression includes all name ending in '.dat' with the exception of 'dummy.dat' "+\.dat$;-^dummy\.dat$"

member.name: T:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256Poly

summary.p: Represents a polynomial whose coefficients are elements of GF(256). Instances of this class are immutable.
Much credit is due to William Rucklidge since portions of this code are an indirect port of his C++ Reed-Solomon implementation.

member.author: Sean Owen
www.Redivivus.in (suraj.supekar@redivivus.in) - Ported from ZXING Java Source

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256Poly.#ctor(Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256,System.Int32[])
member.param: the {@link GF256} instance representing the field to use to perform computations
coefficients as ints representing elements of GF(256), arranged from most significant (highest-power term) coefficient to least significant
member.throws: IllegalArgumentException if argument is null or empty,
member.summary: or if leading coefficient is 0 and this is not a constant polynomial (that is, it is not the monomial "0")

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256Poly.getCoefficient(System.Int32)
member.returns: coefficient of x^degree term in this polynomial

member.returns: evaluation of this polynomial at a given point

member.name: P:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256Poly.Degree
member.returns: degree of this polynomial

member.name: P:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.reedsolomon.GF256Poly.Zero
member.returns: true iff this polynomial is the monomial "0"

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarBuffer
member.summary:
The TarBuffer class implements the tar archive concept of a buffered input stream. This concept goes back to the days of blocked tape drives and special io devices. In the C# universe, the only real function that this class performs is to ensure that files have the correct "record" size, or other tars will complain.
You should never have a need to access this class directly. TarBuffers are created by Tar IO Streams.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarBuffer.BlockSize
member.summary: The size of a block in a tar archive in bytes.
member.remarks: This is 512 bytes.

member.summary: The number of blocks in a default record.
member.remarks: The default value is 20 blocks per record.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarBuffer.DefaultRecordSize
member.summary: The size in bytes of a default record.
member.remarks: The default size is 10KB.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry
member.summary:
This class represents an entry in a zip archive. This can be a file or a directory ZipFile and ZipInputStream will give you instances of this class as information about the members in an archive. ZipOutputStream uses an instance of this class when creating an entry in a Zip file.
Author of the original java version : Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a zip entry with the given name.
member.param: The name for this entry. Can include directory components. The convention for names is 'unix' style paths with relative names only. There are with no device names and path elements are separated by '/' characters.
member.exception: The name passed is null

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a zip entry with the given name and version required to extract
member.param: The name for this entry. Can include directory components. The convention for names is 'unix' style paths with no device names and path elements separated by '/' characters. This is not enforced see CleanName on how to ensure names are valid if this is desired.
The minimum 'feature version' required this entry
member.exception: The name passed is null

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.CompressionMethod)
member.summary: Initializes an entry with the given name and made by information
member.param: Minimum required zip feature version required to extract this entry
member.exception: The name passed is null
versionRequiredToExtract should be 0 (auto-calculate) or > 10
member.remarks: This constructor is used by the ZipFile class when reading from the central header It is not generally useful, use the constructor specifying the name only.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.#ctor(ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry)
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of the given zip entry.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.CleanName(System.String)
member.summary: Cleans a name making it conform to Zip file conventions. Devices names ('c:\') and UNC share names ('\\server\share') are removed and forward slashes ('\') are converted to back slashes ('/'). Names are made relative by trimming leading slashes which is compatible with the ZIP naming convention.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.HasCrc
member.summary: Get a value indicating wether the entry has a CRC value available.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.IsCrypted
member.summary: Get/Set flag indicating if entry is encrypted. A simple helper routine to aid interpretation of flags

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.IsUnicodeText
member.summary: Get / set a flag indicating wether entry name and comment text are encoded in Unicode UTF8

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.CryptoCheckValue
member.summary: Value used during password checking for PKZIP 2.0 / 'classic' encryption.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.Flags
member.summary: Get/Set general purpose bit flag for entry
member.remarks:
General purpose bit flag
Bit 0: If set, indicates the file is encrypted
Bit 1-2 Only used for compression type 6 Imploding, and 8, 9 deflating
Imploding:
Bit 1 if set indicates an 8K sliding dictionary was used. If clear a 4k dictionary was used
Bit 2 if set indicates 3 Shannon-Fanno trees were used to encode the sliding dictionary, 2 otherwise
Deflating:
Bit 2 Bit 1
0 0 Normal compression was used
0 1 Maximum compression was used
1 0 Fast compression was used
1 1 Super fast compression was used
Bit 3: If set, the fields crc-32, compressed size and uncompressed size are were not able to be written during zip file creation The correct values are held in a data descriptor immediately following the compressed data.
Bit 4: Reserved for use by PKZIP for enhanced deflating
Bit 5: If set indicates the file contains compressed patch data
Bit 6: If set indicates strong encryption was used.
Bit 7-15: Unused or reserved

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.ZipFileIndex
member.summary: Get/Set index of this entry in Zip file

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.Offset
member.summary: Get/set offset for use in central header

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.ExternalFileAttributes
member.summary: Get/Set external file attributes as an integer. The values of this are operating system dependant see HostSystem for details

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.VersionMadeBy
member.summary: Get the version made by for this entry or zero if unknown. The value / 10 indicates the major version number, and the value mod 10 is the minor version number

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.HostSystem
member.summary: Gets the compatability information for the external file attribute If the external file attributes are compatible with MS-DOS and can be read by PKZIP for DOS version 2.04g then this value will be zero. Otherwise the value will be non-zero and identify the host system on which the attributes are compatible.
member.remarks:
The values for this as defined in the Zip File format and by others are shown below. The values are somewhat misleading in some cases as they are not all used as shown. You should consult the relevant documentation to obtain up to date and correct information. The modified appnote by the infozip group is particularly helpful as it documents a lot of peculiarities. The document is however a little dated.
0 - MS-DOS and OS/2 (FAT / VFAT / FAT32 file systems)
1 - Amiga
2 - OpenVMS
3 - Unix
4 - VM/CMS
5 - Atari ST
6 - OS/2 HPFS
7 - Macintosh
8 - Z-System
9 - CP/M
10 - Windows NTFS
11 - MVS (OS/390 - Z/OS)
12 - VSE
13 - Acorn Risc
14 - VFAT
15 - Alternate MVS
16 - BeOS
17 - Tandem
18 - OS/400
19 - OS/X (Darwin)
99 - WinZip AES
remainder - unused

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.Version
member.summary: Get minimum Zip feature version required to extract this entry
member.remarks:
Minimum features are defined as:
1.0 - Default value
1.1 - File is a volume label
2.0 - File is a folder/directory
2.0 - File is compressed using Deflate compression
2.0 - File is encrypted using traditional encryption
2.1 - File is compressed using Deflate64
2.5 - File is compressed using PKWARE DCL Implode
2.7 - File is a patch data set
4.5 - File uses Zip64 format extensions
4.6 - File is compressed using BZIP2 compression
5.0 - File is encrypted using DES
5.0 - File is encrypted using 3DES
5.0 - File is encrypted using original RC2 encryption
5.0 - File is encrypted using RC4 encryption
5.1 - File is encrypted using AES encryption
5.1 - File is encrypted using corrected RC2 encryption
5.1 - File is encrypted using corrected RC2-64 encryption
6.1 - File is encrypted using non-OAEP key wrapping
6.2 - Central directory encryption (not confirmed yet)
6.3 - File is compressed using LZMA
6.3 - File is compressed using PPMD+
6.3 - File is encrypted using Blowfish
6.3 - File is encrypted using Twofish

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipEntry.IsDirectory
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the entry is a directory. however.
member.remarks: A directory is determined by an entry name with a trailing slash '/'. The external file attributes can also indicate an entry is for a directory. Currently only dos/windows attributes are tested in this manner. The trailing slash convention should always be followed.

member.name: T:Rss.RssCreativeCommons
member.summary: A RSS module that adds elements at the channel or item level that specifies which Creative Commons license applies.

member.name: M:Rss.RssCreativeCommons.#ctor(System.Uri,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the
member.param: If present as a sub-element of channel, indicates that the content of the RSS file is available under a license, indicated by a URL, which is the value of the license element. A list of some licenses that may be used in this context is on the Creative Commons website on this page, however the license element may point to licenses not authored by Creative Commons. You may also use the license element as a sub-element of item. When used this way it applies only to the content of that item. If an item has a license, and the channel does too, the license on the item applies, i.e. the inner license overrides the outer one. Multiple license elements are allowed, in either context, indicating that the content is available under multiple licenses. "http://www.creativecommons.org/licenses/"
If present as a sub-element of channel then true, otherwise false

member.summary: Sub-format to use when serializing/deserializing data

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.DataFormat.Default
member.summary: Uses the default encoding for the data-type.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.DataFormat.ZigZag
member.summary: When applied to signed integer-based data (including Decimal), this indicates that zigzag variant encoding will be used. This means that values with small magnitude (regardless of sign) take a small amount of space to encode.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.DataFormat.TwosComplement
member.summary: When applied to signed integer-based data (including Decimal), this indicates that two's-complement variant encoding will be used. This means that any -ve number will take 10 bytes (even for 32-bit), so should only be used for compatibility.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.DataFormat.FixedSize
member.summary: When applied to signed integer-based data (including Decimal), this indicates that a fixed amount of space will be used.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.DataFormat.Group
member.summary: When applied to a sub-message, indicates that the value should be treated as group-delimited.

This is an InflaterInputStream that reads the files baseInputStream an zip archive one after another. It has a special method to get the zip entry of the next file. summary.p: Encapsulates a set of error-correction blocks in one symbol version. Most versions will use blocks of differing sizes within one version, so, this encapsulates the parameters for each set of blocks. It also holds the number of error-correction codewords per block since it will be the same across all blocks within one version.

Encapsualtes the parameters for one error-correction block in one symbol version. This includes the number of data codewords, and the number of times a block with these parameters is used consecutively in the QR code version's format.

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.Utility.Redis.Lists.SetTrim(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Trim an existing list so that it will contain only the specified range of elements specified. Out of range indexes will not produce an error: if start is larger than the end of the list, or start > end (in that case end should > 0), the result will be an empty list (which causes key to be removed). If end is larger than the end of the list, Redis will treat it like the last element of the list.
member.param: 0 is from the first,1 is from secoend and so on.
-1 is the last -2 is before the last and so on.

member.name: T:Mtime.Community.SQLServerDAL.SqlHelper
member.summary: The SqlHelper class is intended to encapsulate high performance, scalable best practices for common uses of SqlClient

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.SQLServerDAL.SqlHelper.AttachParameters(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary:
This method is used to attach array of SqlParameters to a SqlCommand.
This method will assign a value of DbNull to any parameter with a direction of InputOutput and a value of null.
This behavior will prevent default values from being used, but this will be the less common case than an intended pure output parameter (derived as InputOutput) where the user provided no input value.
member.param: The command to which the parameters will be added
An array of SqlParameters to be added to command

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.SQLServerDAL.SqlHelper.AssignParameterValues(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: This method assigns dataRow column values to an array of SqlParameters
member.param: Array of SqlParameters to be assigned values
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.SQLServerDAL.SqlHelper.AssignParameterValues(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Object[])
member.summary: This method assigns an array of values to an array of SqlParameters
member.param: Array of SqlParameters to be assigned values
Array of objects holding the values to be assigned

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.SQLServerDAL.SqlHelper.PrepareCommand(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Boolean@)
member.summary: This method opens (if necessary) and assigns a connection, transaction, command type and parameters to the provided command
member.param: A valid SqlConnection, on which to execute this command
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
true if the connection was opened by the method, otherwose is false.

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.SQLServerDAL.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders");
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.SQLServerDAL.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders", new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.SQLServerDAL.SqlHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.

The name of the stored prcedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure

member.name: M:Mtime.Community.SQLServerDAL.SqlHelper.ExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],Mtime.Community.SQLServerDAL.SqlHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership)
member.summary: Create and prepare a SqlCommand, and call ExecuteReader with the appropriate CommandBehavior.
member.remarks:
If we created and opened the connection, we want the connection to be closed when the DataReader is closed.
If the caller provided the connection, we want to leave it to them to manage.
member.param: A valid SqlConnection, on which to execute this command
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
Indicates whether the connection parameter was provided by the caller, or created by SqlHelper
member.returns: SqlDataReader containing the results of the command

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater
member.summary:
Inflater is used to decompress data that has been compressed according to the "deflate" standard described in rfc1951.
By default Zlib (rfc1950) headers and footers are expected in the input. You can use constructor public Inflater(bool noHeader) passing true if there is no Zlib header information
The usage is as following. First you have to set some input with SetInput(), then Inflate() it. If inflate doesn't inflate any bytes there may be three reasons:
IsNeedingInput() returns true because the input buffer is empty. You have to provide more input with SetInput(). NOTE: IsNeedingInput() also returns true when, the stream is finished.
IsNeedingDictionary() returns true, you have to provide a preset dictionary with SetDictionary().
IsFinished returns true, the inflater has finished.
Once the first output byte is produced, a dictionary will not be needed at a later stage.
author of the original java version : John Leuner, Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater
member.summary:
This is the Deflater class. The deflater class compresses input with the deflate algorithm described in RFC 1951. It has several compression levels and three different strategies described below.
This class is not thread safe. This is inherent in the API, due to the split of deflate and setInput.
author of the original java version : Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.BEST_COMPRESSION
member.summary: The best and slowest compression level. This tries to find very long and distant string repetitions.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.BEST_SPEED
member.summary: The worst but fastest compression level.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.DEFAULT_COMPRESSION
member.summary: The default compression level.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.NO_COMPRESSION
member.summary: This level won't compress at all but output uncompressed blocks.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.DEFLATED
member.summary: The compression method. This is the only method supported so far. There is no need to use this constant at all.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with default compression level.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with given compression level.
member.param: the compression level, a value between NO_COMPRESSION and BEST_COMPRESSION, or DEFAULT_COMPRESSION.
member.exception: if lvl is out of range.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with given compression level.
member.param: the compression level, a value between NO_COMPRESSION and BEST_COMPRESSION.
true, if we should suppress the Zlib/RFC1950 header at the beginning and the adler checksum at the end of the output. This is useful for the GZIP/PKZIP formats.
member.exception: if lvl is out of range.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Reset
member.summary: Resets the deflater. The deflater acts afterwards as if it was just created with the same compression level and strategy as it had before.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the current input block. Further calls to deflate() will produce enough output to inflate everything in the current input block. This is not part of Sun's JDK so I have made it package private. It is used by DeflaterOutputStream to implement flush().

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Finish
member.summary: Finishes the deflater with the current input block. It is an error to give more input after this method was called. This method must be called to force all bytes to be flushed.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetInput(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the data which should be compressed next. This should be only called when needsInput indicates that more input is needed. If you call setInput when needsInput() returns false, the previous input that is still pending will be thrown away. The given byte array should not be changed, before needsInput() returns true again. This call is equivalent to setInput(input, 0, input.length).
member.param: the buffer containing the input data.
member.exception: if the buffer was finished() or ended().

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetInput(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the data which should be compressed next. This should be only called when needsInput indicates that more input is needed. The given byte array should not be changed, before needsInput() returns true again.
member.param: the buffer containing the input data.
the number of data bytes of input.
member.exception: if the buffer was Finish()ed or if previous input is still pending.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the compression level. There is no guarantee of the exact position of the change, but if you call this when needsInput is true the change of compression level will occur somewhere near before the end of the so far given input.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.GetLevel
member.summary: Get current compression level
member.returns: Returns the current compression level

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetStrategy(ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflateStrategy)
member.summary: Sets the compression strategy. Strategy is one of DEFAULT_STRATEGY, HUFFMAN_ONLY and FILTERED. For the exact position where the strategy is changed, the same as for SetLevel() applies.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Deflate(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deflates the current input block with to the given array.
member.param: The buffer where compressed data is stored
member.returns: The number of compressed bytes added to the output, or 0 if either IsNeedingInput() or IsFinished returns true or length is zero.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Deflate(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deflates the current input block to the given array.
member.param: Buffer to store the compressed data.
The maximum number of bytes that may be stored.
member.returns: The number of compressed bytes added to the output, or 0 if either needsInput() or finished() returns true or length is zero.
member.exception: If Finish() was previously called.
If offset or length don't match the array length.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetDictionary(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the dictionary which should be used in the deflate process. This call is equivalent to setDictionary(dict, 0, dict.Length).
member.exception: if SetInput () or Deflate () were already called or another dictionary was already set.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the dictionary which should be used in the deflate process. The dictionary is a byte array containing strings that are likely to occur in the data which should be compressed. The dictionary is not stored in the compressed output, only a checksum. To decompress the output you need to supply the same dictionary again.
member.param: The index where dictionary information commences.
The number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.exception: If SetInput () or Deflate() were already called or another dictionary was already set.

member.summary: Compression level.

members.member:
The TarOutputStream writes a UNIX tar archive as an OutputStream. Methods are provided to put entries, and then write their contents by writing to this stream using write().
public

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Construct TarOutputStream using default block factor

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Construct TarOutputStream with user specified block factor

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: set the position within the current stream

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: set the length of the current stream

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Read a byte from the stream and advance the position within the stream by one byte or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The byte value or -1 if at end of stream

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: read bytes from the current stream and advance the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read, or zero if at the end of the stream

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.Flush
member.summary: All buffered data is written to destination

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.Finish
member.summary: Ends the TAR archive without closing the underlying OutputStream. The result is that the EOF block of nulls is written.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.Close
member.summary: Ends the TAR archive and closes the underlying OutputStream.
member.remarks: This means that Finish() is called followed by calling the TarBuffer's Close().

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.GetRecordSize
member.summary: Get the record size being used by this stream's TarBuffer.
member.returns: The TarBuffer record size.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.PutNextEntry(ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarEntry)
member.summary: Put an entry on the output stream. This writes the entry's header and positions the output stream for writing the contents of the entry. Once this method is called, the stream is ready for calls to write() to write the entry's contents. Once the contents are written, closeEntry() MUST be called to ensure that all buffered data is completely written to the output stream.
member.param: The TarEntry to be written to the archive.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.CloseEntry
member.summary: Close an entry. This method MUST be called for all file entries that contain data. The reason is that we must buffer data written to the stream in order to satisfy the buffer's block based writes. Thus, there may be data fragments still being assembled that must be written to the output stream before this entry is closed and the next entry written.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the current tar archive entry. This method simply calls Write(byte[], int, int).

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Tar.TarOutputStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes bytes to the current tar archive entry. This method is aware of the current entry and will throw an exception if you attempt to write bytes past the length specified for the current entry. The method is also (painfully) aware of the record buffering required by TarBuffer, and manages buffers that are not a multiple of recordsize in length, including assembling records from small buffers.
member.param: The buffer to write to the archive.
The offset in the buffer from which to get bytes.
The number of bytes to write.

member.summary: Write an EOF (end of archive) block to the tar archive. An EOF block consists of all zeros.

member.name: T:Mtime.Community.Utility.zxing.common.BitMatrixInternal

summary.p: Represents a 2D matrix of bits. In function arguments below, and throughout the common module, x is the column position, and y is the row position. The ordering is always x, y. The origin is at the top-left.
Internally the bits are represented in a 1-D array of 32-bit ints. However, each row begins with a new int. This is done intentionally so that we can copy out a row into a BitArray very efficiently.
The ordering of bits is row-major. Within each int, the least significant bits are used first, meaning they represent lower x values. This is compatible with BitArray's implementation.

member.author: Sean Owen
dswitkin@google.com (Daniel Switkin)
www.Redivivus.in (suraj.supekar@redivivus.in) - Ported from ZXING Java Source
